page.title: 02FARMING MUTHILL MAIN CROPS
page.content: The land in our area is used mainly for farmland and woodland. {Barley} is the most common crop. The head is used for{malting}.Before it is malted it has to be tested to make sure it is suitable. The rejected barley is crushed and given to the cows. The stalks are used for bedding cows, sheep or pigs in winter. {Wheat} and {oats} are also grown but there is less of these than barley. The oats are sold for seed. The wheat is used for animal feed. {Grass} is grown on much of the land for grazing {cows, horses}and {sheep} .In winter, sheep from the hills are brought down to this area where there is more food. The cattle and sheep are taken to market at Stirling or Perth. {Rough grazing} is grass that is not fertilised - used mainly for sheep.
